1799  /* Block until a message arrives and determine the source and size
1800  of the message. */
1801  SU2_MPI::Status status;
1802  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank+2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1803  int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1804 
1805  int sizeMess;
1806  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
1807 
1808  /* Allocate the memory for the receive buffer as well as for the
1809  return send buffer. Receive the message afterwards. */
1810  vector<unsigned long> recvBuf(sizeMess);
1811  sendReturnBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1812 
1813  SU2_MPI::Recv(recvBuf.data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG,
1814  source, rank+2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1815 
1816  /* Loop over the data just received and fill the return send buffer
1817  with the color of the DOFs. */
1818  for(int j=0; j<sizeMess; ++j) {
1819  const unsigned long jj = recvBuf[j] - nDOFsPerRank[rank];
1820  if(jj >= nDOFsLocOwned) {
1821  SU2_MPI::Error("This DOF should be owned, but it is not. This should not happen.",CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1822  }
1823  sendReturnBuf[i][j] = colorLocalDOFs[jj];
1824  }
1825 
1826  /* Send the return buffer back to the calling rank. Again use non-blocking
1827  sends to avoid deadlock. */
1828  SU2_MPI::Isend(sendReturnBuf[i].data(), sendReturnBuf[i].size(), MPI_INT,
1829  source, source+3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &sendReturnReqs[i]);
1830  }
1831 
1832  /* Complete the first round of non-blocking sends. */
1833  SU2_MPI::Waitall(sendReqs.size(), sendReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1834 
1835  /* Loop over the ranks from which I receive the return information. */
1836  for(unsigned long i=0; i<rankCommToInd.size(); ++i) {
1837 
1838  /* Block until a message arrives and determine the source of the message
1839  and its index in the original send buffers. */
1840  SU2_MPI::Status status;
1841  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank+3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1842  int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1843 
1844  MI = rankCommToInd.find(source);
1845  const int ind = MI->second;
1846 
1847  /* Allocate the memory for the receive buffer and receive the message using
1848  a blocking receive. */
1849  vector<int> recvBuf(sendBuf[ind].size());
1850  SU2_MPI::Recv(recvBuf.data(), recvBuf.size(), MPI_INT,
1851  source, rank+3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1852 
1853  /* Loop over the data just received and add them to the map
1854  mapMatrixIndToColor .*/
1855  for(unsigned long j=0; j<sendBuf[ind].size(); ++j)
1856  mapMatrixIndToColor[sendBuf[ind][j]] = recvBuf[j];
1857  }
1858 
1859  /* Complete the second round of non-blocking sends. */
1860  SU2_MPI::Waitall(sendReturnReqs.size(), sendReturnReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1861 
1862  /* Wild cards have been used in the communication,
1863  so synchronize the ranks to avoid problems. */
1864  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1865 
1866 #endif
1867 
1868  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1869  /*--- Part 3: For each locally owned DOF it is determined which matrix ---*/
1870  /*--- entry is computed for which color. This information is ---*/
1871  /*--- stored in the vector of vectors colorToIndEntriesJacobian. ---*/
1872  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1873 
1874  /* Loop over the ownded DOFs. */
1875  colorToIndEntriesJacobian.resize(nDOFsLocOwned);
1876  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nDOFsLocOwned; ++i) {
1877 
1878  /* Initialize the elements of colorToIndEntriesJacobian to -1 to indicate
1879  that the color does not have a matrix entity . */
1880  colorToIndEntriesJacobian[i].assign(nGlobalColors, -1);
1881 
1882  /* Loop over the matrix entries of this DOF. */
1883  for(int j=0; j<(int) nonZeroEntriesJacobian[i].size(); ++j) {
1884 
1885  /* Search for the entry in mapMatrixIndToColor and determine the
1886  color of this entry. */
1887  map<unsigned long, int>::const_iterator MMI;
1888  MMI = mapMatrixIndToColor.find(nonZeroEntriesJacobian[i][j]);
1889  if(MMI == mapMatrixIndToColor.end()) {
1890  cout << "Matrix entry not found in mapMatrixIndToColor." << endl;
1891  cout << "This should not happen." << endl;
1892  exit(1);
1893  }
1894  const int color = MMI->second;
1895 
1896  /* Set the correct information in colorToIndEntriesJacobian. */
1897  colorToIndEntriesJacobian[i][color] = j;
1898  }
1899  }
1900 }
1901 
1902 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::SetUpTaskList(CConfig *config) {
1903 
1904  /* Check whether an ADER space-time step must be carried out.
1905  When only a spatial Jacobian is computed this is false per definition. */
1906  if( (config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) &&
1907  !(config->GetJacobian_Spatial_Discretization_Only()) ) {
1908 
1909  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1910  /* ADER time integration with local time stepping. There are 2^(M-1) */
1911  /* subtime steps, where M is the number of time levels. For each of */
1912  /* the subtime steps a number of tasks must be carried out, hence the */
1913  /* total list can become rather lengthy. */
1914  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1915 
1916  /*--- Determine whether or not the predictor solution must be interpolated
1917  for the time levels on this rank. Make a distinction between owned
1918  and halo elements. Also determine whether or not boundary conditions
1919  are present and whether or not these depend on halo data. ---*/
1920  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
1921  vector<bool> interpolOwnedElem(nTimeLevels, false);
1922  vector<bool> interpolHaloElem(nTimeLevels, false);
1923  vector<bool> BCPresent(nTimeLevels, false);
1924  vector<bool> BCDependOnHalos(nTimeLevels, false);
1925 
1926  for(unsigned short level=0; level<nTimeLevels; ++level) {
1927 
1928  /* First check the boundary conditions. */
1929  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<config->GetnMarker_All(); iMarker++) {
1930 
1931  const unsigned long surfElemBeg = boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[level];
1932  const unsigned long surfElemEnd = boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[level+1];
1933  if(surfElemEnd > surfElemBeg) {
1934  BCPresent[level] = true;
1935  if( boundaries[iMarker].haloInfoNeededForBC ) BCDependOnHalos[level] = true;
1936  }
1937  }
1938 
1939  /* Determine whether or not the owned elements must be interpolated. */
1940  if(nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level+1] > nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level])
1941  interpolOwnedElem[level] = true;
1942  if(nMatchingInternalFacesLocalElem[level+1] > nMatchingInternalFacesLocalElem[level])
1943  interpolOwnedElem[level] = true;
1944  if(nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level+1] > nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level])
1945  interpolOwnedElem[level] = true;
1946  if( BCPresent[level] )
1947  interpolOwnedElem[level] = true;
1948 
1949  /* Determine whether or not the halo elements must be interpolated. */
1950  if(nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level+1] > nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level])
1951  interpolHaloElem[level] = true;
1952  if( BCDependOnHalos[level] )
1953  interpolHaloElem[level] = true;
1954  }
1955 
1956  /* Determine the number of subtime steps and abbreviate the number of
1957  time integration points a bit easier. */
1958  const unsigned int nSubTimeSteps = pow(2,nTimeLevels-1);
1959  const unsigned short nTimeIntegrationPoints = config->GetnTimeIntegrationADER_DG();
1960 
1961  /* Define the two dimensional vector to store the latest index for a
1962  certain task for every time level. */
1963  vector<vector<int> > indexInList(CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION+1,
1964  vector<int>(nTimeLevels, -1));
1965 
1966  /* Loop over the number of subtime steps in the algorithm. */
1967  for(unsigned int step=0; step<nSubTimeSteps; ++step) {
1968 
1969  /* Determine the time level for which an update must be carried out
1970  for this step. */
1971  unsigned int ii = step+1;
1972  unsigned short timeLevel = 0;
1973  while( !(ii%2) ) {ii/=2; ++timeLevel;}
1974 
1975  /* Definition of the variable to store previous indices of
1976  tasks that must have been completed. */
1977  int prevInd[5];
1978 
1979  /* Carry out the predictor step of the communication elements of level 0
1980  if these elements are present on this rank. */
1981  unsigned long elemBeg = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[0]
1982  + nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel[0];
1983  unsigned long elemEnd = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[1];
1984  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) {
1985  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION][0];
1986  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][0] = (int)tasksList.size();
1987  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS, 0, prevInd[0]);
1988  }
1989 
1990  /* Initiate the communication of elements of level 0, if there is
1991  something to be communicated. */
1992 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1993  if( !commRequests[0].empty() ) {
1994  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) // Data needs to be computed before sending.
1995  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][0];
1996  else // Data only needs to be received.
1997  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS][0];
1998 
1999  /* Make sure that any previous communication has been completed. */
2000  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][0];
2001 
2002  /* Create the task. */
2003  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][0] = tasksList.size();
2004  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0,
2005  prevInd[0], prevInd[1]);
2006  }
2007 #endif
2008 
2009  /* Check if the time level is not nTimeLevels-1. In that case carry out
2010  the predictor step of the communication elements for the next time
2011  level and initiate their communication, if appropriate on this rank. */
2012  if(timeLevel < (nTimeLevels-1)) {
2013  const unsigned short nL = timeLevel+1;
2014 
2015  /* Carry out the predictor step of the communication elements of level nL
2016  if these elements are present on this rank. */
2017  elemBeg = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[nL] + nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel[nL];
2018  elemEnd = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[nL+1];
2019 
2020  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) {
2021  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION][nL];
2022  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][nL] = (int)tasksList.size();
2023  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS, nL, prevInd[0]);
2024  }
2025 
2026  /* Initiate the communication of elements of level nL, if there is
2027  something to be communicated. */
2028 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2029  if( !commRequests[nL].empty() ) {
2030  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) // Data needs to be computed before sending.
2031  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][nL];
2032  else // Data only needs to be received.
2033  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS][nL];
2034 
2035  /* Make sure that any previous communication has been completed. */
2036  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][nL];
2037 
2038  /* Create the actual task. */
2039  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][nL] = tasksList.size();
2040  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, nL,
2041  prevInd[0], prevInd[1]);
2042  }
2043 #endif
2044  }
2045 
2046  /* Carry out the predictor step of the internal elements of time level 0,
2047  if these elements are present on this rank. */
2048  elemBeg = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[0];
2049  elemEnd = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[0] + nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel[0];
2050 
2051  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) {
2052  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION][0];
2053  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][0] = (int)tasksList.size();
2054  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS, 0, prevInd[0]);
2055  }
2056 
2057  /* Determine the tasks to be completed before the communication of time
2058  level 0 can be completed. */
2059  prevInd[0] = prevInd[1] = prevInd[2] = -1;
2060 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2061  if( !commRequests[0].empty() )
2062  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][0];
2063 #endif
2064 
2065  if( !elementsSendSelfComm[0].empty() ) {
2066  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][0];
2067  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][0];
2068  }
2069 
2070  /* Make sure that the -1 in prevInd, if any, are numbered last. */
2071  sort(prevInd, prevInd+3, greater<int>());
2072 
2073  /* Complete the communication of time level 0, if there is something
2074  to be completed. */
2075  if(prevInd[0] > -1) {
2076  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][0] = (int)tasksList.size();
2077  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0,
2078  prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]);
2079  }
2080 
2081  /* Check if the time level is not nTimeLevels-1. In that case carry out
2082  the predictor step of the internal elements for the next time
2083  level and complete the communication for this time level,
2084  if appropriate on this rank. */
2085  if(timeLevel < (nTimeLevels-1)) {
2086  const unsigned short nL = timeLevel+1;
2087 
2088  /* Carry out the predictor step of the internal elements of level nL
2089  if these elements are present on this rank. */
2090  elemBeg = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[nL];
2091  elemEnd = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[nL] + nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel[nL];
2092 
2093  if(elemEnd > elemBeg) {
2094  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION][nL];
2095  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][nL] = (int)tasksList.size();
2096  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS, nL, prevInd[0]);
2097  }
2098 
2099  /* Determine the tasks to be completed before the communication of time
2100  level nL can be completed. */
2101  prevInd[0] = prevInd[1] = prevInd[2] = -1;
2102 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2103  if( !commRequests[nL].empty() )
2104  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][nL];
2105 #endif
2106 
2107  if( !elementsSendSelfComm[nL].empty() ) {
2108  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][nL];
2109  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][nL];
2110  }
2111 
2112  /* Make sure that the -1 in prevInd, if any, are numbered last. */
2113  sort(prevInd, prevInd+3, greater<int>());
2114 
2115  /* Complete the communication of time level nL, if there is something
2116  to be completed. */
2117  if(prevInd[0] > -1) {
2118  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][nL] = (int)tasksList.size();
2119  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, nL,
2120  prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]);
2121  }
2122  }
2123 
2124  /* Loop over the time integration points to compute the space time
2125  integral for the corrector step. */
2126  for(unsigned short intPoint=0; intPoint<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++intPoint) {
2127 
2128  /* Loop over the time levels to be treated. */
2129  for(unsigned short level=0; level<=timeLevel; ++level) {
2130 
2131  /* Easier storage of the number of owned elements for this level
2132  and the number of owned elements of the adjacent time level
2133  that are needed for the computation of the surface integral. */
2134  unsigned long nOwnedElem = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level+1]
2135  - nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level];
2136 
2137  unsigned long nAdjOwnedElem = 0;
2138  if(level < (nTimeLevels-1))
2139  nAdjOwnedElem = ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[level+1].size();
2140 
2141  /* Check if the solution of the owned elements of the current time
2142  level and the adjacent owned elements of the next time level must
2143  be interpolated to the integration point intPoint. */
2144  if( interpolOwnedElem[level] ) {
2145 
2146  /* Determine the tasks that should have been completed before this
2147  task can be carried out. This depends on the time integration
2148  point. */
2149  if(intPoint == 0) {
2150 
2151  /* First time integration point. The predictor steps of the
2152  owned elements must have been completed before this task
2153  can be carried out. */
2154  if( nOwnedElem ) {
2155  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][level];
2156  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][level];
2157  }
2158  else {
2159  prevInd[0] = prevInd[1] = -1;
2160  }
2161 
2162  if( nAdjOwnedElem ) {
2163  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS][level+1];
2164  prevInd[3] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS][level+1];
2165  }
2166  else {
2167  prevInd[2] = prevInd[3] = -1;
2168  }
2169 
2170  prevInd[4] = -1;
2171  }
2172  else {
2173 
2174  /* Not the first integration point. The residual computations of
2175  the previous integration point must have been completed, because
2176  the solution in the work vectors is overwritten. */
2177  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL][level];
2178  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED][level];
2179  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO][level];
2180  prevInd[3] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2181  prevInd[4] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2182  }
2183 
2184  /* Create the task. */
2185  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2186  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_OWNED_ELEMENTS,
2187  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2], prevInd[3], prevInd[4]);
2188 
2189  /* The info on the integration point and whether or not this
2190  time integration corresponds to the second part for the
2191  adjacent elements must be added to the task just created. */
2192  tasksList.back().intPointADER = intPoint;
2193  tasksList.back().secondPartTimeIntADER = level < timeLevel;
2194 
2195  /* If artificial viscosity is used for the shock capturing
2196  terms, these terms must be computed for the owned elements,
2197  including the adjacent ones. */
2198  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2199  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2200  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS,
2201  level, prevInd[0]);
2202  }
2203 
2204  /* The solution of the halo elements of the current time level and
2205  the adjacent halo elements of the next time level must be
2206  interpolated to the integration point intPoint. Check if these
2207  elements are present. */
2208  if( interpolHaloElem[level] ) {
2209 
2210  unsigned long nAdjHaloElem = 0;
2211  if(level < (nTimeLevels-1))
2212  nAdjHaloElem = haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel[level+1].size();
2213 
2214  unsigned long nHaloElem = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[level+1]
2215  - nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[level];
2216 
2217  /* Determine the tasks that should have been completed before this
2218  task can be carried out. This depends on the time integration
2219  point. */
2220  if(intPoint == 0) {
2221 
2222  /* First time integration point. The communication of the
2223  halo elements must have been completed before this task
2224  can be carried out. */
2225  if( nHaloElem )
2226  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level];
2227  else
2228  prevInd[0] = -1;
2229 
2230  if( nAdjHaloElem )
2231  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level+1];
2232  else
2233  prevInd[1] = -1;
2234  }
2235  else {
2236 
2237  /* Not the first integration point. The residual computation of
2238  the previous integration point must have been completed, because
2239  the solution in the work vectors is overwritten. */
2240  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2241  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO][level];
2242  }
2243 
2244  /* Create the task. */
2245  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2246  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS,
2247  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1]);
2248 
2249  /* The info on the integration point and whether or not this
2250  time integration corresponds to the second part for the
2251  adjacent elements must be added to the task just created. */
2252  tasksList.back().intPointADER = intPoint;
2253  tasksList.back().secondPartTimeIntADER = level < timeLevel;
2254 
2255  /* If artificial viscosity is used for the shock capturing
2256  terms, these terms must be computed for the halo elements,
2257  including the adjacent ones. */
2258  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2259  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2260  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS,
2261  level, prevInd[0]);
2262  }
2263 
2264  /* Check whether there are boundary conditions that involve halo elements. */
2265  if( BCDependOnHalos[level] ) {
2266 
2267  /* Create the dependency list for this task. */
2268  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2269  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2270 
2271  /* Create the task for the boundary conditions that involve halo elements. */
2272  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2273  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO,
2274  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1]);
2275  }
2276 
2277  /* Compute the surface residuals for this time level that involve
2278  halo elements, if present. Afterwards, accumulate the space time
2279  residuals for the halo elements. */
2280  if(nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level+1] >
2281  nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[level]) {
2282 
2283  /* Create the dependencies for the surface residual part that involve
2284  halo elements. For all but the first integration point, make sure
2285  that the previous residual is already accumulated, because this
2286  task will overwrite that residual. */
2287  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2288  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2289 
2290  if(intPoint == 0)
2291  prevInd[2] = -1;
2292  else
2293  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2294 
2295  /* Create the task for the surface residual. */
2296  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2297  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS,
2298  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]);
2299 
2300  /* Create the task to accumulate the surface residuals of the halo
2301  elements. Make sure to set the integration point for this task. */
2302  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2303  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2304  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS,
2305  level, prevInd[0]);
2306  tasksList.back().intPointADER = intPoint;
2307  }
2308 
2309  /* If this is the last integration point, initiate the reverse
2310  communication for the residuals of this time level, if there
2311  is something to communicate. */
2312  if(intPoint == (nTimeIntegrationPoints-1)) {
2313 
2314  /* Check if there is something to communicate. Despite the fact
2315  that self communication takes place when the reverse communication
2316  is completed, a check for self communication is still needed,
2317  because of the periodic transformations. */
2318  bool commData = false;
2319 
2320 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2321  if( !commRequests[level].empty() ) commData = true;
2322 #endif
2323  if(commData || !elementsSendSelfComm[level].empty()) {
2324 
2325  /* Determine the dependencies before the reverse communication
2326  can start. */
2327  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2328  if( !haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel[level].empty() )
2329  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level-1];
2330  else
2331  prevInd[1] = -1;
2332 
2333  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level];
2334 
2335  /* Create the task. */
2336  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2337  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION,
2338  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]);
2339  }
2340  }
2341 
2342  /* Compute the contribution of the volume integral, boundary conditions that only
2343  involve owned elements and surface integral between owned elements for this
2344  time level, if present. */
2345  if( nOwnedElem ) {
2346 
2347  /* Create the dependencies for this task. The shock capturing viscosity of
2348  the owned elements must be completed and for all integration points but
2349  the first, the computed residuals must have been accumulated in the space
2350  time residual, because the tasks below will overwrite the residuals. */
2351  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2352  if(intPoint == 0)
2353  prevInd[1] = -1;
2354  else
2355  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2356 
2357  /* Create the tasks. */
2358  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2359  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL, level,
2360  prevInd[0], prevInd[1]);
2361 
2362  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2363  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED, level,
2364  prevInd[0], prevInd[1]);
2365 
2366  if(nMatchingInternalFacesLocalElem[level+1] >
2367  nMatchingInternalFacesLocalElem[level]) {
2368  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2369  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS,
2370  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1]);
2371  }
2372  }
2373 
2374  /* Accumulate the space time residuals for the owned elements of this
2375  level, if these elements are present. */
2376  if(nAdjOwnedElem || nOwnedElem) {
2377 
2378  /* Create the dependencies for this task. */
2379  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL][level];
2380  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED][level];
2381  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO][level];
2382  prevInd[3] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2383  prevInd[4] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS][level];
2384 
2385  /* Create the task. */
2386  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2387  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS,
2388  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2], prevInd[3], prevInd[4]);
2389  tasksList.back().intPointADER = intPoint;
2390  }
2391 
2392  /* If this is the last integration point, complete the reverse
2393  communication for the residuals of this time level, if there
2394  is something to communicate. */
2395  if(intPoint == (nTimeIntegrationPoints-1)) {
2396 
2397  bool commData = false;
2398 
2399 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2400  if( !commRequests[level].empty() ) commData = true;
2401 #endif
2402  if(commData || !elementsSendSelfComm[level].empty()) {
2403 
2404  /* Determine the dependencies before the reverse communication
2405  can be completed. */
2406  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level];
2407  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2408  if( !ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[level].empty() )
2409  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level-1];
2410  else
2411  prevInd[2] = -1;
2412 
2413  /* Create the task. */
2414  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2415  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION,
2416  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]);
2417  }
2418  }
2419 
2420  } /* End loop time level. */
2421 
2422  } /* End loop time integration points. */
2423 
2424  /* Loop again over the number of active time levels for this subtime
2425  step and compute the update for the DOFs of the owned elements. */
2426  for(unsigned short level=0; level<=timeLevel; ++level) {
2427  if(nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level+1] > nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[level]) {
2428 
2429  /* Updates must be carried out for this time level. First multiply the
2430  residuals by the inverse of the mass matrix. This task can be
2431  completed if the communication of this level has been completed.
2432  However, it is possible that no communication is needed and
2433  therefore the accumulation of the space time residuals is also
2434  added to the dependency list. */
2435  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION][level];
2436  prevInd[1] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level];
2437  if( !ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[level].empty() )
2438  prevInd[2] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS][level-1];
2439  else
2440  prevInd[2] = -1;
2441 
2442  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2443  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX,
2444  level, prevInd[0], prevInd[1], prevInd[2]);
2445 
2446  /* Compute the new state vector for this time level. */
2447  prevInd[0] = indexInList[CTaskDefinition::MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX][level];
2448  indexInList[CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION][level] = (int)tasksList.size();
2449  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION,
2450  level, prevInd[0]);
2451  }
2452  }
2453 
2454  } /* End loop subtime steps. */
2455 
2456 
2457  // EXTRA FOR DEBUGGING
2458 /* for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) {
2459  if(i == rank) {
2460  cout << endl;
2461  cout << "Task list for rank " << rank << endl;
2462  cout << "------------------------------------------------" << endl;
2463  cout << "Number of tasks: " << tasksList.size() << endl;
2464  for(unsigned long j=0; j<tasksList.size(); ++j) {
2465 
2466  cout << "Task " << j << ": ";
2467  switch( tasksList[j].task ) {
2468  case CTaskDefinition::NO_TASK: cout << "NO_TASK" << endl; break;
2469  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_COMM_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2470  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_PREDICTOR_STEP_INTERNAL_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2471  case CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION: cout << "INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION" << endl; break;
2472  case CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION: cout << "COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION" << endl; break;
2473  case CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION: cout << "INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION" << endl; break;
2474  case CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION: cout << "COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION" << endl; break;
2475  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_OWNED_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_OWNED_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2476  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_TIME_INTERPOLATE_HALO_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2477  case CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS: cout << "SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2478  case CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS: cout << "SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2479  case CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL: cout << "VOLUME_RESIDUAL" << endl; break;
2480  case CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS: cout << "SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2481  case CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS: cout << "SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2482  case CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED: cout << "BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED" << endl; break;
2483  case CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO: cout << "BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO" << endl; break;
2484  case CTaskDefinition::SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_OWNED_ELEMENTS: cout << "SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_OWNED_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2485  case CTaskDefinition::SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_HALO_ELEMENTS: cout << "SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_HALO_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2486  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2487  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS: cout << "ADER_ACCUMULATE_SPACETIME_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS" << endl; break;
2488  case CTaskDefinition::MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX: cout << "MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX" << endl; break;
2489  case CTaskDefinition::ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION: cout << "ADER_UPDATE_SOLUTION" << endl; break;
2490  default: cout << "This cannot happen" << endl;
2491  }
2492  cout << " Time level: " << tasksList[j].timeLevel
2493  << " Integration point: " << tasksList[j].intPointADER
2494  << " Second part: " << tasksList[j].secondPartTimeIntADER << endl;
2495  cout << " Depends on tasks:";
2496  for(unsigned short k=0; k<tasksList[j].nIndMustBeCompleted; ++k)
2497  cout << " " << tasksList[j].indMustBeCompleted[k];
2498  cout << endl << endl;
2499  }
2500 
2501  }
2502 
2503 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2504  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2505 #endif
2506  }
2507 
2508  cout << "CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::SetUpTaskList: ADER tasklist printed" << endl;
2509  exit(1); */
2510 
2511  // END EXTRA FOR DEBUGGING.
2512  }
2513  else {
2514 
2515  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2516  /* Standard time integration scheme for which the spatial residual must */
2517  /* be computed for the DOFS of the owned elements. This results in a */
2518  /* relatively short tasks list, which can be set easily. */
2519  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2520 
2521  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0); // Task 0
2522  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_OWNED_ELEMENTS, 0); // Task 1
2523  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::VOLUME_RESIDUAL, 0, 1); // Task 2
2524  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0, 0); // Task 3
2525  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::SHOCK_CAPTURING_VISCOSITY_HALO_ELEMENTS, 0, 3); // Task 4
2526  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_HALO_ELEMENTS, 0, 1, 4); // Task 5
2527  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_HALO, 0, 1, 3); // Task 6
2528  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_HALO_ELEMENTS, 0, 5); // Task 7
2529  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::INITIATE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0, 7); // Task 8
2530  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::SURFACE_RESIDUAL_OWNED_ELEMENTS, 0, 1); // Task 9
2531  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS_DEPEND_ON_OWNED, 0, 1); // Task 10
2532  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::COMPLETE_REVERSE_MPI_COMMUNICATION, 0, 2, 8); // Task 11
2533  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::SUM_UP_RESIDUAL_CONTRIBUTIONS_OWNED_ELEMENTS, 0, 2, 6, 9, 10, 11); // Task 12
2534  tasksList.emplace_back(CTaskDefinition::MULTIPLY_INVERSE_MASS_MATRIX, 0, 12); // Task 13
2535  }
2536 }
2537 
2538 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Prepare_MPI_Communication(const CMeshFEM *FEMGeometry,
2539  CConfig *config) {
2540 
2541  /*--- Get the communication information from DG_Geometry. Note that for a
2542  FEM DG discretization the communication entities of FEMGeometry contain
2543  the volume elements. ---*/
2544  const vector<int> &ranksSend = FEMGeometry->GetRanksSend();
2545  const vector<int> &ranksRecv = FEMGeometry->GetRanksRecv();
2546  const vector<vector<unsigned long> > &elementsSend = FEMGeometry->GetEntitiesSend();
2547  const vector<vector<unsigned long> > &elementsRecv = FEMGeometry->GetEntitiesRecv();
2548 
2549  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2550  /*--- Step 1. Create the triple vector, which contains elements to be ---*/
2551  /*--- sent and received per time level. Note that when time ---*/
2552  /*--- accurate local time stepping is not used, this is just a ---*/
2553  /*--- copy of elementsSend and elementsRecv. ---*/
2554  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2555 
2556  /* Allocate the first two indices of the triple vectors. */
2557  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
2558 
2559  vector<vector<vector<unsigned long> > > elemSendPerTimeLevel, elemRecvPerTimeLevel;
2560  elemSendPerTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
2561  elemRecvPerTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
2562 
2563  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i) {
2564  elemSendPerTimeLevel[i].resize(elementsSend.size());
2565  elemRecvPerTimeLevel[i].resize(elementsRecv.size());
2566  }
2567 
2568  /* Loop over the send data and set the corresponding data
2569  in elemSendPerTimeLevel. */
2570  for(unsigned long i=0; i<elementsSend.size(); ++i) {
2571  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsSend[i].size(); ++j) {
2572  const unsigned long ii = elementsSend[i][j];
2573  elemSendPerTimeLevel[volElem[ii].timeLevel][i].push_back(ii);
2574  }
2575  }
2576 
2577  /* Loop over the receive data and set the corresponding data
2578  in recvSendPerTimeLevel. */
2579  for(unsigned long i=0; i<elementsRecv.size(); ++i) {
2580  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsRecv[i].size(); ++j) {
2581  const unsigned long ii = elementsRecv[i][j];
2582  elemRecvPerTimeLevel[volElem[ii].timeLevel][i].push_back(ii);
2583  }
2584  }
2585 
2586  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2587  /*--- Step 2. Find out whether or not self communication is present and ---*/
2588  /*--- set the corresponding data for elementsSendSelfComm and ---*/
2589  /*--- elementsRecvSelfComm for all time levels. This can only be ---*/
2590  /*--- the case when periodic boundaries are present in the grid. ---*/
2591  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2592 
2593  /* Allocate the first index of elementsSendSelfComm and elementsRecvSelfComm. */
2594  elementsSendSelfComm.resize(nTimeLevels);
2595  elementsRecvSelfComm.resize(nTimeLevels);
2596 
2597  /* Loop over the ranks to which data is sent and copy the elements for self
2598  communication for all time levels. */
2599  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
2600  if(ranksSend[i] == rank) {
2601  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeLevels; ++j)
2602  elementsSendSelfComm[j] = elemSendPerTimeLevel[j][i];
2603  }
2604  }
2605 
2606  /* Loop over the ranks from which data is received and copy the elements
2607  for self communication for all time levels. */
2608  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
2609  if(ranksRecv[i] == rank) {
2610  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeLevels; ++j)
2611  elementsRecvSelfComm[j] = elemRecvPerTimeLevel[j][i];
2612  }
2613  }
2614 
2615 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2616 
2617  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2618  /*--- Step 3. Determine the MPI communication patterns for ---*/
2619  /*--- all time levels. ---*/
2620  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2621 
2622  /* Determine the number of time DOFs that must be communicated.
2623  For non-ADER schemes this is simply set to 1. */
2624  unsigned short nTimeDOFs = 1;
2625  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG)
2626  nTimeDOFs = config->GetnTimeDOFsADER_DG();
2627 
2628  /* Determine the number of items per DOF that must be communicated. */
2629  const unsigned short nItemsPerDOF = nTimeDOFs*nVar;
2630 
2631  /* Allocate the memory for the first index of the vectors that
2632  determine the MPI communication patterns. */
2633  commRequests.resize(nTimeLevels);
2634  elementsRecvMPIComm.resize(nTimeLevels);
2635  elementsSendMPIComm.resize(nTimeLevels);
2636  ranksRecvMPI.resize(nTimeLevels);
2637  ranksSendMPI.resize(nTimeLevels);
2638  commRecvBuf.resize(nTimeLevels);
2639  commSendBuf.resize(nTimeLevels);
2640 
2641  /* Loop over the time levels. */
2642  for(unsigned short level=0; level<nTimeLevels; ++level) {
2643 
2644  /* Determine the number of ranks from which data will be received
2645  for this time level. Self communication is excluded. */
2646  int nRankRecv = 0;
2647  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
2648  if((ranksRecv[i] != rank) && !elemRecvPerTimeLevel[level][i].empty()) ++nRankRecv;
2649  }
2650 
2651  /* Determine the number of ranks to which data will be send
2652  for this time level. Self communication is excluded. */
2653  int nRankSend = 0;
2654  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
2655  if((ranksSend[i] != rank) && !elemSendPerTimeLevel[level][i].empty()) ++nRankSend;
2656  }
2657 
2658  /* Allocate the memory for the second index of the vectors that
2659  determine the MPI communication. */
2660  commRequests[level].resize(nRankRecv+nRankSend);
2661  elementsRecvMPIComm[level].resize(nRankRecv);
2662  elementsSendMPIComm[level].resize(nRankSend);
2663  ranksRecvMPI[level].resize(nRankRecv);
2664  ranksSendMPI[level].resize(nRankSend);
2665  commRecvBuf[level].resize(nRankRecv);
2666  commSendBuf[level].resize(nRankSend);
2667 
2668  /* Determine the receive information. */
2669  nRankRecv = 0;
2670  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
2671  if((ranksRecv[i] != rank) && !elemRecvPerTimeLevel[level][i].empty()) {
2672 
2673  /* Copy the elements to be received and the rank from where they come. */
2674  elementsRecvMPIComm[level][nRankRecv] = elemRecvPerTimeLevel[level][i];
2675  ranksRecvMPI[level][nRankRecv] = ranksRecv[i];
2676 
2677  /* Determine the size of the receive buffer and allocate the memory. */
2678  unsigned long sizeBuf = 0;
2679  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsRecvMPIComm[level][nRankRecv].size(); ++j) {
2680  const unsigned long jj = elementsRecvMPIComm[level][nRankRecv][j];
2681  sizeBuf += volElem[jj].nDOFsSol;
2682  }
2683 
2684  sizeBuf *= nItemsPerDOF;
2685  commRecvBuf[level][nRankRecv].resize(sizeBuf);
2686 
2687  /* Update nRankRecv. */
2688  ++nRankRecv;
2689  }
2690  }
2691 
2692  /* Determine the send information. */
2693  nRankSend = 0;
2694  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
2695  if((ranksSend[i] != rank) && !elemSendPerTimeLevel[level][i].empty()) {
2696 
2697  /* Copy the elements to be sent and the rank to where they are sent. */
2698  elementsSendMPIComm[level][nRankSend] = elemSendPerTimeLevel[level][i];
2699  ranksSendMPI[level][nRankSend] = ranksSend[i];
2700 
2701  /* Determine the size of the send buffer and allocate the memory. */
2702  unsigned long sizeBuf = 0;
2703  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsSendMPIComm[level][nRankSend].size(); ++j) {
2704  const unsigned long jj = elementsSendMPIComm[level][nRankSend][j];
2705  sizeBuf += volElem[jj].nDOFsSol;
2706  }
2707 
2708  sizeBuf *= nItemsPerDOF;
2709  commSendBuf[level][nRankSend].resize(sizeBuf);
2710 
2711  /* Update nRankSend. */
2712  ++nRankSend;
2713  }
2714  }
2715  }
2716 
2717 #endif
2718 
2719  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2720  /*--- Step 4. Store the information for the rotational periodic ---*/
2721  /*--- corrections for the halo elements. ---*/
2722  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2723 
2724  /* Get the data for the rotational periodic halos from FEMGeometry. */
2725  const vector<unsigned short> &markersRotPer = FEMGeometry->GetRotPerMarkers();
2726  const vector<vector<unsigned long> > &rotPerHalos = FEMGeometry->GetRotPerHalos();
2727 
2728  /* Allocate the memory for the first and second index of
2729  halosRotationalPeriodicity. Also allocate the memory to store the
2730  rotation matrices of the periodic transformations. */
2731  const unsigned short nRotPerMarkers = markersRotPer.size();
2732  halosRotationalPeriodicity.resize(nTimeLevels);
2733  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
2734  halosRotationalPeriodicity[i].resize(nRotPerMarkers);
2735 
2736  rotationMatricesPeriodicity.resize(9*nRotPerMarkers);
2737 
2738  /* Loop over the rotational periodic transformations. */
2739  unsigned int ii = 0;
2740  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nRotPerMarkers; ++i) {
2741 
2742  /* Get the rotation angles from config for this marker. */
2743  const unsigned short pInd = markersRotPer[i];
2744  auto angles = config->GetPeriodicRotAngles(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(pInd));
2745 
2746  /*--- Determine the rotation matrix from the donor to the halo elements.
2747  This is the transpose of the rotation matrix from the halo to the
2748  donor elements, which is stored in periodic angles of the marker. ---*/
2749  const su2double theta = angles[0], phi = angles[1], psi = angles[2];
2750 
2751  const su2double cosTheta = cos(theta), cosPhi = cos(phi), cosPsi = cos(psi);
2752  const su2double sinTheta = sin(theta), sinPhi = sin(phi), sinPsi = sin(psi);
2753 
2754  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = cosPhi*cosPsi;
2755  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = cosPhi*sinPsi;
2756  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = -sinPhi;
2757 
2758  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = sinTheta*sinPhi*cosPsi - cosTheta*sinPsi;
2759  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = sinTheta*sinPhi*sinPsi + cosTheta*cosPsi;
2760  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = sinTheta*cosPhi;
2761 
2762  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = cosTheta*sinPhi*cosPsi + sinTheta*sinPsi;
2763  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = cosTheta*sinPhi*sinPsi - sinTheta*cosPsi;
2764  rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++] = cosTheta*cosPhi;
2765 
2766  /* Loop over the elements of this periodic transformation and store them
2767  in the appropriate location of halosRotationalPeriodicity. */
2768  for(unsigned long j=0; j<rotPerHalos[i].size(); ++j) {
2769  const unsigned long jj = rotPerHalos[i][j];
2770  halosRotationalPeriodicity[volElem[jj].timeLevel][i].push_back(jj);
2771  }
2772  }
2773 }
2774 
2775 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Initiate_MPI_Communication(CConfig *config,
2776  const unsigned short timeLevel) {
2777 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2778 
2779  /* Check if there is anything to communicate. */
2780  if( !commRequests[timeLevel].empty() ) {
2781 
2782  /* Set the pointer to the memory, whose data must be communicated.
2783  This depends on the time integration scheme used. For ADER the data of
2784  the predictor part is communicated, while for the other time integration
2785  schemes typically the working solution is communicated. Note that if the
2786  working solution is communicated, there is only one time level. */
2787  unsigned short nTimeDOFs;
2788  su2double *commData;
2789  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) {
2790  nTimeDOFs = config->GetnTimeDOFsADER_DG();
2791  commData = VecSolDOFsPredictorADER.data();
2792  }
2793  else {
2794  nTimeDOFs = 1;
2795  commData = VecWorkSolDOFs[0].data();
2796  }
2797 
2798  /* Loop over the number of ranks to which this rank must send data. */
2799  int indComm = 0;
2800  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSendMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i, ++indComm) {
2801  unsigned long ii = 0;
2802 
2803  /* Loop over the elements to be sent and copy the solution data
2804  into the send buffer. */
2805  su2double *sendBuf = commSendBuf[timeLevel][i].data();
2806  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsSendMPIComm[timeLevel][i].size(); ++j) {
2807  const unsigned long jj = elementsSendMPIComm[timeLevel][i][j];
2808  const unsigned long nItems = volElem[jj].nDOFsSol * nVar;
2809 
2810  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k) {
2811  const unsigned long indS = nVar*(volElem[jj].offsetDOFsSolLocal + k*nDOFsLocTot);
2812  for(unsigned long mm=0; mm<nItems; ++mm)
2813  sendBuf[ii+mm] = commData[indS+mm];
2814  ii += nItems;
2815  }
2816  }
2817 
2818  /* Send the data using non-blocking sends. */
2819  int dest = ranksSendMPI[timeLevel][i];
2820  int tag = dest + timeLevel;
2821  SU2_MPI::Isend(sendBuf, ii, MPI_DOUBLE, dest, tag, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
2822  &commRequests[timeLevel][indComm]);
2823  }
2824 
2825  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which data is received. */
2826  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecvMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i, ++indComm) {
2827 
2828  /* Post the non-blocking receive. */
2829  int source = ranksRecvMPI[timeLevel][i];
2830  int tag = rank + timeLevel;
2831  SU2_MPI::Irecv(commRecvBuf[timeLevel][i].data(),
2832  commRecvBuf[timeLevel][i].size(),
2833  MPI_DOUBLE, source, tag, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
2834  &commRequests[timeLevel][indComm]);
2835  }
2836  }
2837 
2838 #endif
2839 }
2840 
2841 bool CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Complete_MPI_Communication(CConfig *config,
2842  const unsigned short timeLevel,
2843  const bool commMustBeCompleted) {
2844 
2845  /* Set the pointer to the memory, whose data must be communicated.
2846  This depends on the time integration scheme used. For ADER the data of
2847  the predictor part is communicated, while for the other time integration
2848  schemes typically the working solution is communicated. Note that if the
2849  working solution is communicated, there is only one time level. */
2850  unsigned short nTimeDOFs;
2851  su2double *commData;
2852  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) {
2853  nTimeDOFs = config->GetnTimeDOFsADER_DG();
2854  commData = VecSolDOFsPredictorADER.data();
2855  }
2856  else {
2857  nTimeDOFs = 1;
2858  commData = VecWorkSolDOFs[0].data();
2859  }
2860 
2861  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2862  /*--- Complete the MPI communication, if needed and if possible, and ---*/
2863  /*--- copy the data from the receive buffers into the correct ---*/
2864  /*--- location in commData. ---*/
2865  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2866 
2867 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2868  if( !commRequests[timeLevel].empty() ) {
2869 
2870  /*--- There are communication requests to be completed. Check if these
2871  requests must be completed. In that case Waitall is used.
2872  Otherwise, Testall is used to check if all the requests have
2873  been completed. If not, false is returned. ---*/
2874  if( commMustBeCompleted ) {
2875  SU2_MPI::Waitall(commRequests[timeLevel].size(),
2876  commRequests[timeLevel].data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
2877  }
2878  else {
2879  int flag;
2880  SU2_MPI::Testall(commRequests[timeLevel].size(),
2881  commRequests[timeLevel].data(), &flag, MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
2882  if( !flag ) return false;
2883  }
2884 
2885  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which this rank has received data. */
2886  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecvMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i) {
2887  unsigned long ii = 0;
2888 
2889  /* Loop over the elements to be received and copy the solution data
2890  into commData. */
2891  su2double *recvBuf = commRecvBuf[timeLevel][i].data();
2892  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsRecvMPIComm[timeLevel][i].size(); ++j) {
2893  const unsigned long jj = elementsRecvMPIComm[timeLevel][i][j];
2894  const unsigned long nItems = volElem[jj].nDOFsSol * nVar;
2895 
2896  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k) {
2897  const unsigned long indR = nVar*(volElem[jj].offsetDOFsSolLocal + k*nDOFsLocTot);
2898  for(unsigned long mm=0; mm<nItems; ++mm)
2899  commData[indR+mm] = recvBuf[ii+mm];
2900  ii += nItems;
2901  }
2902  }
2903  }
2904  }
2905 #endif
2906 
2907  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2908  /*--- Carry out the self communication. ---*/
2909  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2910 
2911  /* Loop over the number of elements involved and copy the data of the DOFs. */
2912  for(unsigned long i=0; i<elementsSendSelfComm[timeLevel].size(); ++i) {
2913  const unsigned long elemS = elementsSendSelfComm[timeLevel][i];
2914  const unsigned long elemR = elementsRecvSelfComm[timeLevel][i];
2915  const unsigned long nItems = volElem[elemS].nDOFsSol * nVar;
2916 
2917  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
2918  const unsigned long indS = nVar*(volElem[elemS].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j*nDOFsLocTot);
2919  const unsigned long indR = nVar*(volElem[elemR].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j*nDOFsLocTot);
2920 
2921  for(unsigned long mm=0; mm<nItems; ++mm)
2922  commData[indR+mm] = commData[indS+mm];
2923  }
2924  }
2925 
2926  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2927  /*--- Correct the vector quantities in the rotational periodic halo's. ---*/
2928  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2929 
2930  /*--- Loop over the markers for which a rotational periodic
2931  correction must be applied to the momentum variables. ---*/
2932  unsigned int ii = 0;
2933  const unsigned long nRotPerMarkers = halosRotationalPeriodicity[timeLevel].size();
2934  for(unsigned long k=0; k<nRotPerMarkers; ++k) {
2935 
2936  /* Easier storage of the rotational matrix. */
2937  su2double rotMatrix[3][3];
2938 
2939  rotMatrix[0][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2940  rotMatrix[0][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2941  rotMatrix[0][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2942 
2943  rotMatrix[1][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2944  rotMatrix[1][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2945  rotMatrix[1][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2946 
2947  rotMatrix[2][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2948  rotMatrix[2][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2949  rotMatrix[2][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
2950 
2951  /* Determine the number of elements for this transformation and
2952  loop over them. */
2953  const unsigned long nHaloElem = halosRotationalPeriodicity[timeLevel][k].size();
2954  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nHaloElem; ++j) {
2955 
2956  /* Easier storage of the halo index and loop over its DOFs, including
2957  the multiple time DOFs for ADER. */
2958  for(unsigned short tInd=0; tInd<nTimeDOFs; ++tInd) {
2959  const unsigned long tIndOff = tInd*nDOFsLocTot;
2960  const unsigned long ind = halosRotationalPeriodicity[timeLevel][k][j];
2961  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[ind].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
2962 
2963  /* Determine the pointer in commData where the solution of this DOF
2964  is stored and copy the momentum variables. Note that a rotational
2965  correction can only take place for a 3D simulation. */
2966  su2double *sol = commData + nVar*(volElem[ind].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i + tIndOff);
2967 
2968  const su2double ru = sol[1], rv = sol[2], rw = sol[3];
2969 
2970  /* Correct the momentum variables. */
2971  sol[1] = rotMatrix[0][0]*ru + rotMatrix[0][1]*rv + rotMatrix[0][2]*rw;
2972  sol[2] = rotMatrix[1][0]*ru + rotMatrix[1][1]*rv + rotMatrix[1][2]*rw;
2973  sol[3] = rotMatrix[2][0]*ru + rotMatrix[2][1]*rv + rotMatrix[2][2]*rw;
2974  }
2975  }
2976  }
2977  }
2978 
2979  /* Return true to indicate that the communication has been completed. */
2980  return true;
2981 }
2982 
2983 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Initiate_MPI_ReverseCommunication(CConfig *config,
2984  const unsigned short timeLevel) {
2985 
2986  /* Set the pointer to the residual to be communicated. */
2987  su2double *resComm;
2988  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) resComm = VecTotResDOFsADER.data();
2989  else resComm = VecResDOFs.data();
2990 
2991  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2992  /*--- Correct the vector residuals in the rotational periodic halo's. ---*/
2993  /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2994 
2995  /*--- Loop over the markers for which a rotational periodic
2996  correction must be applied to the momentum variables. ---*/
2997  unsigned int ii = 0;
2998  const unsigned short nRotPerMarkers = halosRotationalPeriodicity[0].size();
2999  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nRotPerMarkers; ++k) {
3000 
3001  /* Easier storage of the transpose of the rotational matrix. */
3002  su2double rotMatrix[3][3];
3003 
3004  rotMatrix[0][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
3005  rotMatrix[1][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
3006  rotMatrix[2][0] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
3007 
3008  rotMatrix[0][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
3009  rotMatrix[1][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
3010  rotMatrix[2][1] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
3011 
3012  rotMatrix[0][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
3013  rotMatrix[1][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
3014  rotMatrix[2][2] = rotationMatricesPeriodicity[ii++];
3015 
3016  /* Determine the number of elements for this transformation and
3017  loop over them. */
3018  const unsigned long nHaloElem = halosRotationalPeriodicity[timeLevel][k].size();
3019  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nHaloElem; ++j) {
3020 
3021  /* Easier storage of the halo index and loop over its DOFs. */
3022  const unsigned long ind = halosRotationalPeriodicity[timeLevel][k][j];
3023  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[ind].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
3024 
3025  /* Determine the pointer in VecResDOFs where the residual of this DOF
3026  is stored and copy the momentum residuals. Note that a rotational
3027  correction can only take place for a 3D simulation. */
3028  su2double *res = resComm + nVar*(volElem[ind].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i);
3029 
3030  const su2double ru = res[1], rv = res[2], rw = res[3];
3031 
3032  /* Correct the momentum variables. */
3033  res[1] = rotMatrix[0][0]*ru + rotMatrix[0][1]*rv + rotMatrix[0][2]*rw;
3034  res[2] = rotMatrix[1][0]*ru + rotMatrix[1][1]*rv + rotMatrix[1][2]*rw;
3035  res[3] = rotMatrix[2][0]*ru + rotMatrix[2][1]*rv + rotMatrix[2][2]*rw;
3036  }
3037  }
3038  }
3039 
3040 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
3041 
3042  /* Check if there is anything to communicate. */
3043  if( !commRequests[timeLevel].empty() ) {
3044 
3045  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which this rank receives data in
3046  the original communication pattern. In the reverse pattern, data
3047  has to be sent. */
3048  int indComm = 0;
3049  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecvMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i, ++indComm) {
3050  unsigned long ii = 0;
3051 
3052  /* Loop over the elements copy the residual data into recvBuf. */
3053  su2double *recvBuf = commRecvBuf[timeLevel][i].data();
3054  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsRecvMPIComm[timeLevel][i].size(); ++j) {
3055  const unsigned long jj = elementsRecvMPIComm[timeLevel][i][j];
3056  const unsigned long nItems = volElem[jj].nDOFsSol * nVar;
3057 
3058  const unsigned long indS = nVar*volElem[jj].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
3059  for(unsigned long mm=0; mm<nItems; ++mm)
3060  recvBuf[ii+mm] = resComm[indS+mm];
3061  ii += nItems;
3062  }
3063 
3064  /* Send the data using non-blocking sends. */
3065  int dest = ranksRecvMPI[timeLevel][i];
3066  int tag = dest + timeLevel + 20;
3067  SU2_MPI::Isend(recvBuf, ii, MPI_DOUBLE, dest, tag, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
3068  &commRequests[timeLevel][indComm]);
3069  }
3070 
3071  /* Post the non-blocking receives. As this is the reverse communication,
3072  a loop over the sending ranks must be carried out. */
3073  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSendMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i, ++indComm) {
3074 
3075  int source = ranksSendMPI[timeLevel][i];
3076  int tag = rank + timeLevel + 20;
3077  SU2_MPI::Irecv(commSendBuf[timeLevel][i].data(),
3078  commSendBuf[timeLevel][i].size(),
3079  MPI_DOUBLE, source, tag, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
3080  &commRequests[timeLevel][indComm]);
3081  }
3082  }
3083 
3084 #endif
3085 
3086 }
3087 
3088 bool CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Complete_MPI_ReverseCommunication(CConfig *config,
3089  const unsigned short timeLevel,
3090  const bool commMustBeCompleted) {
3091  /* Set the pointer to the residual to be communicated. */
3092  su2double *resComm;
3093  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) resComm = VecTotResDOFsADER.data();
3094  else resComm = VecResDOFs.data();
3095 
3096 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
3097 
3098  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3099  /*--- Complete the MPI communication, if needed and if possible. ---*/
3100  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3101 
3102  /* Check if there are any requests to complete for this time level. */
3103  if( !commRequests[timeLevel].empty() ) {
3104 
3105  /*--- There are communication requests to be completed. Check if these
3106  requests must be completed. In that case Waitall is used.
3107  Otherwise, Testall is used to check if all the requests have
3108  been completed. If not, return false. ---*/
3109  if( commMustBeCompleted ) {
3110  SU2_MPI::Waitall(commRequests[timeLevel].size(),
3111  commRequests[timeLevel].data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
3112  }
3113  else {
3114  int flag;
3115  SU2_MPI::Testall(commRequests[timeLevel].size(),
3116  commRequests[timeLevel].data(), &flag, MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
3117  if( !flag ) return false;
3118  }
3119 
3120  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3121  /*--- Update the residuals of the owned DOFs with the data received. ---*/
3122  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3123 
3124  /*--- Loop over the received residual data from all ranks and update the
3125  residual of the DOFs of the corresponding elements. Note that in
3126  reverse mode the send communication data must be used. ---*/
3127  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSendMPI[timeLevel].size(); ++i) {
3128 
3129  /* Loop over the elements that must be updated. */
3130  unsigned long nn = 0;
3131  for(unsigned long j=0; j<elementsSendMPIComm[timeLevel][i].size(); ++j) {
3132  const unsigned long jj = elementsSendMPIComm[timeLevel][i][j];
3133 
3134  /* Easier storage of the starting residual of this element and the
3135  data in the buffer and update the residuals of the DOFs. */
3136  const unsigned short nRes = nVar*volElem[jj].nDOFsSol;
3137  su2double *res = resComm + nVar*volElem[jj].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
3138  const su2double *buf = commSendBuf[timeLevel][i].data() + nn;
3139 
3140  nn += nRes;
3141  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nRes; ++k)
3142  res[k] += buf[k];
3143  }
3144  }
3145  }
3146 
3147 #endif
3148 
3149  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3150  /*--- Carry out the self communication. ---*/
3151  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3152 
3153  /*--- Loop over the number of elements involved and update the residuals
3154  of the owned DOFs. ---*/
3155  for(unsigned long i=0; i<elementsSendSelfComm[timeLevel].size(); ++i) {
3156 
3157  const unsigned long volOwned = elementsSendSelfComm[timeLevel][i];
3158  const unsigned long volHalo = elementsRecvSelfComm[timeLevel][i];
3159  su2double *resOwned = resComm + nVar*volElem[volOwned].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
3160  su2double *resHalo = resComm + nVar*volElem[volHalo].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
3161 
3162  const unsigned short nRes = nVar*volElem[volOwned].nDOFsSol;
3163  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nRes; ++j)
3164  resOwned[j] += resHalo[j];
3165  }
3166 
3167  /* Initialize the halo residuals of the just completed communication pattern
3168  to zero if ADER-DG is used. */
3169  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) {
3170  const unsigned long iBeg = nVar*volElem[nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[timeLevel]].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
3171  const unsigned long volIndEnd = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[timeLevel+1]-1;
3172  const unsigned long iEnd = nVar*(volElem[volIndEnd].offsetDOFsSolLocal
3173  + volElem[volIndEnd].nDOFsSol);
3174 
3175  for(unsigned long i=iBeg; i<iEnd; ++i)
3176  VecTotResDOFsADER[i] = 0.0;
3177  }
3178 
3179  /* Return true to indicate that the communication has been completed. */
3180  return true;
3181 }
3182 
3183 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::SetInitialCondition(CGeometry **geometry, CSolver ***solver_container, CConfig *config, unsigned long TimeIter) {
3184 
3185  /*--- Check if a verification solution is to be computed. ---*/
3186  if ((VerificationSolution) && (TimeIter == 0)) {
3187 
3188  /* Loop over the owned elements. */
3189  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
3190 
3191  /* Loop over the DOFs of this element. */
3192  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[i].nDOFsSol; ++j) {
3193 
3194  /* Set the pointers to the coordinates and solution of this DOF. */
3195  const su2double *coor = volElem[i].coorSolDOFs.data() + j*nDim;
3196  su2double *solDOF = VecSolDOFs.data() + nVar*(volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j);
3197 
3198  /* Set the solution in this DOF to the initial condition provided by
3199  the verification solution class. This can be the exact solution,
3200  but this is not necessary. */
3201  VerificationSolution->GetInitialCondition(coor, solDOF);
3202  }
3203  }
3204  }
3205 }
3206 
3207 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Preprocessing(CGeometry *geometry, CSolver **solver_container, CConfig *config, unsigned short iMesh, unsigned short iStep, unsigned short RunTime_EqSystem, bool Output) {
3208 
3209  unsigned long ErrorCounter = 0;
3210 
3211  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3212  /*--- Check for non-physical points. Only needed for a compressible solver. ---*/
3213  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3214 
3215  if(config->GetKind_Regime() == ENUM_REGIME::COMPRESSIBLE) {
3216 
3217  /*--- Make a distinction between 2D and 3D for optimal performance. ---*/
3218  switch( nDim ) {
3219 
3220  case 2: {
3221  /*--- 2D simulation. Loop over the owned DOFs and check for
3222  non-physical solutions. If found, the state is overwritten with
3223  the free-stream values. This usually does not work. ---*/
3224  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nDOFsLocOwned; ++i) {
3225  su2double *solDOF = VecSolDOFs.data() + nVar*i;
3226  const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/solDOF[0];
3227  const su2double Mom2 = solDOF[1]*solDOF[1] + solDOF[2]*solDOF[2];
3228  const su2double StaticEnergy = DensityInv*(solDOF[3] - 0.5*DensityInv*Mom2);
3229 
3230  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(solDOF[0], StaticEnergy);
3231  const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
3232  const su2double Temperature = FluidModel->GetTemperature();
3233 
3234  if((Pressure < 0.0) || (solDOF[0] < 0.0) || (Temperature < 0.0)) {
3235  ++ErrorCounter;
3236 
3237  solDOF[0] = ConsVarFreeStream[0]; solDOF[1] = ConsVarFreeStream[1];
3238  solDOF[2] = ConsVarFreeStream[2]; solDOF[3] = ConsVarFreeStream[3];
3239  }
3240  }
3241 
3242  break;
3243  }
3244 
3245  case 3: {
3246  /*--- 3D simulation. Loop over the owned DOFs and check for
3247  non-physical solutions. If found, the state is overwritten with
3248  the free-stream values. This usually does not work. ---*/
3249  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nDOFsLocOwned; ++i) {
3250  su2double *solDOF = VecSolDOFs.data() + nVar*i;
3251  const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/solDOF[0];
3252  const su2double Mom2 = solDOF[1]*solDOF[1] + solDOF[2]*solDOF[2]
3253  + solDOF[3]*solDOF[3];
3254  const su2double StaticEnergy = DensityInv*(solDOF[4] - 0.5*DensityInv*Mom2);
3255 
3256  FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(solDOF[0], StaticEnergy);
3257  const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
3258  const su2double Temperature = FluidModel->GetTemperature();
3259 
3260  if((Pressure < 0.0) || (solDOF[0] < 0.0) || (Temperature < 0.0)) {
3261  ++ErrorCounter;
3262 
3263  solDOF[0] = ConsVarFreeStream[0]; solDOF[1] = ConsVarFreeStream[1];
3264  solDOF[2] = ConsVarFreeStream[2]; solDOF[3] = ConsVarFreeStream[3];
3265  solDOF[4] = ConsVarFreeStream[4];
3266  }
3267  }
3268 
3269  break;
3270  }
3271  }
3272 
3273  /*--- Collect the number of non-physical points for this iteration. ---*/
3274  if (config->GetComm_Level() == COMM_FULL) {
3275 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
3276  unsigned long MyErrorCounter = ErrorCounter;
3277  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&MyErrorCounter, &ErrorCounter, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3278 #endif
3279  if (iMesh == MESH_0) config->SetNonphysical_Points(ErrorCounter);
3280  }
3281  }
3282 
3283  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3284  /* Check for grid motion. */
3285  /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3286 
3287  const bool harmonic_balance = config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::HARMONIC_BALANCE;
3288  if(config->GetGrid_Movement() && !harmonic_balance) {
3289 
3290  /*--- Determine the type of grid motion. ---*/
3291  switch( config->GetKind_GridMovement() ) {
3292 
3293  case ROTATING_FRAME:
3294  case STEADY_TRANSLATION: {
3295 
3296  /* Steady motion. This is accounted for in the general preprocessing,
3297  where grid velocities are computed. */
3298  break;
3299  }
3300 
3301  case RIGID_MOTION: {
3302 
3303  /* Rigid body motion described. At the moment this is only
3304  possible for the Classical Runge Kutta scheme. */
3305  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme() != CLASSICAL_RK4_EXPLICIT)
3306  SU2_MPI::Error("Rigid body motion only possible for CLASSICAL_RK4_EXPLICIT.",
3307  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3308 
3309  /* Determine whether or not it is needed to compute the motion data. */
3310  const unsigned long TimeIter = config->GetTimeIter();
3311 
3312  bool computeMotion = false, firstTime = false;
3313  if(TimeIter == 0 && iStep == 0) computeMotion = firstTime = true;
3314  if(iStep == 1 || iStep == 3) computeMotion = true;
3315 
3316  if( computeMotion ) {
3317 
3318  /* Determine the number of time levels. For the classical Runge-Kutta
3319  scheme this should be 1. */
3320  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
3321 
3322  /* Determine the time for which the motion data must be determined. */
3323  const su2double deltaT = config->GetDelta_UnstTimeND();
3324 
3325  su2double tNew = TimeIter*deltaT;
3326  if( iStep ) tNew += 0.25*(iStep+1)*deltaT;
3327 
3328  /* Determine the time for which the currently stored position was
3329  calculated. */
3330  const su2double tOld = tNew - 0.5*deltaT;
3331 
3332  /* Hard code the plunging motion in y-direction. */
3333  const su2double b2New = 0.25*tNew*tNew*(3.0-tNew);
3334  const su2double db2Newdt = 0.75*tNew*(2.0-tNew);
3335 
3336  const su2double b2Old = 0.25*tOld*tOld*(3.0-tOld);
3337  const su2double dB2 = b2New - b2Old;
3338 
3339  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3340  /*--- Update the coordinates of the DOFs (both grid and solution) ---*/
3341  /*--- and of the integration points (volume and surfaces). ---*/
3342  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3343 
3344  /* The coordinates must be updated if this is not the first
3345  first stage of the first time step. */
3346  if( !firstTime ) {
3347 
3348  /* Adapt the coordinates of the grid points. */
3349  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nMeshPoints; ++l)
3350  meshPoints[l].coor[1] += dB2;
3351 
3352  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
3353  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
3354 
3355  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
3356  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
3357  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3358 
3359  /* Adapt the coordinates of the volume integration points. */
3360  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3361  su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
3362  coor[1] += dB2;
3363  }
3364 
3365  /* Adapt the coordinates of the solution DOFs. */
3366  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
3367  su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
3368  coor[1] += dB2;
3369  }
3370  }
3371 
3372  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
3373  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[nTimeLevels]; ++l) {
3374 
3375  /* Get the required information from the standard element. */
3376  const unsigned short ind = matchingInternalFaces[l].indStandardElement;
3377  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3378 
3379  /* Adapt the coordinates of the surface integration points. */
3380  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3381  su2double *coor = matchingInternalFaces[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
3382  coor[1] += dB2;
3383  }
3384  }
3385 
3386  /* The physical boundary faces. Exclude the periodic boundaries,
3387  because these are not physical boundaries. */
3388  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3389 
3390  if( !(boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary) ) {
3391 
3392  /* Easier storage of the variables for this boundary. */
3393  const unsigned long nSurfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size();
3394  CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.data();
3395 
3396  /*--- Loop over the surface elements and update the coordinates of
3397  the integration points. ---*/
3398  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nSurfElem; ++l) {
3399  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
3400  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3401 
3402  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3403  su2double *coor = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
3404  coor[1] += dB2;
3405  }
3406  }
3407  }
3408  }
3409  }
3410 
3411  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3412  /*--- Compute the grid velocities of the volume solution DOFs and ---*/
3413  /*--- and of the integration points (volume and surfaces). ---*/
3414  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3415 
3416  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
3417  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
3418 
3419  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
3420  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
3421  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3422 
3423  /* Compute the grid velocity in the integration points. */
3424  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3425  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
3426  gridVel[1] = db2Newdt;
3427  }
3428 
3429  /* Compute the grid velocities for the solution DOFs. */
3430  for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
3431  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocitiesSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
3432  gridVel[1] = db2Newdt;
3433  }
3434  }
3435 
3436  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
3437  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nMatchingInternalFacesWithHaloElem[nTimeLevels]; ++l) {
3438 
3439  /* Get the required information from the standard element. */
3440  const unsigned short ind = matchingInternalFaces[l].indStandardElement;
3441  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3442 
3443  /* Compute the grid velocity in the integration points. */
3444  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3445  su2double *gridVel = matchingInternalFaces[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
3446  gridVel[1] = db2Newdt;
3447  }
3448  }
3449 
3450  /* The physical boundary faces. Exclude the periodic boundaries,
3451  because these are not physical boundaries. */
3452  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3453 
3454  if( !(boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary) ) {
3455 
3456  /* Easier storage of the variables for this boundary. */
3457  const unsigned long nSurfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size();
3458  CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.data();
3459 
3460  /*--- Loop over the surface elements and compute the grid velocities
3461  of the integration points. ---*/
3462  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nSurfElem; ++l) {
3463  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
3464  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
3465 
3466  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
3467  su2double *gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
3468  gridVel[1] = db2Newdt;
3469  }
3470  }
3471  }
3472  }
3473  }
3474 
3475  break;
3476  }
3477 
3478  default: {
3479  SU2_MPI::Error("Only rigid body motion possible for DG-FEM solver at the moment.",
3480  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3481  }
3482  }
3483  }
3484 }
3485 
3486 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Postprocessing(CGeometry *geometry, CSolver **solver_container, CConfig *config,
3487  unsigned short iMesh) { }
3488 
3489 void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ComputeSpatialJacobian(CGeometry *geometry, CSolver **solver_container,
3490  CNumerics **numerics, CConfig *config,
3491  unsigned short iMesh, unsigned short RunTime_EqSystem) {
3492 
3493  /* Write a message that the Jacobian is being computed. */
3494  if(rank == MASTER_NODE) {
3495  cout << endl;
3496  cout << "Computing the Jacobian via coloring." << endl;
3497  cout << endl << flush;
3498  }
3499 
3500  /* Easier storage of the number of variables squared. */
3501  const unsigned short nVar2 = nVar*nVar;
3502 
3503  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3504  /*--- Step 1: Computation of the actual Jacobian by looping over the ---*/
3505  /*--- of colors and disturbing the appropriate DOFs for each ---*/
3506  /*--- color. Note that for each color an additional loop over ---*/
3507  /*--- the number of variables is needed to create the Jacobian. ---*/
3508  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3509 
3510  /* Determine the number of non-zeros in the Jacobian matrix for the owned
3511  DOFs in cumulative storage format. */
3512  vector<unsigned long> nNonZeroEntries(nDOFsLocOwned+1);
3513 
3514  nNonZeroEntries[0] = 0;
3515  for(unsigned i=0; i<nDOFsLocOwned; ++i)
3516  nNonZeroEntries[i+1] = nNonZeroEntries[i] + nonZeroEntriesJacobian[i].size();
3517 
3518  /* Copy the solution into the working variables. */
3519  Set_OldSolution();
3520 
3521  /* Allocate the memory for local part of the Jacobian. Note that passivedouble
3522  must be used for the Jacobian matrix. */
3523  vector<passivedouble> Jacobian(nVar2*nNonZeroEntries[nDOFsLocOwned]);
3524 
3525  /* Loop over the colors and write a message, if needed. */
3526  for(int color=0; color<nGlobalColors; ++color) {
3527 
3528  if(rank == MASTER_NODE && !(color%10)) {
3529  cout << "Color " << color+1 << " out of " << nGlobalColors
3530  << " is computed" << endl;
3531  }
3532 
3533  /* Loop over the number of variables. */
3534  for(short var=0; var<nVar; ++var) {
3535 
3536  /* Loop over the DOFs that must be disturbed for this color. */
